author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) State president Kummanam Rajasekharan has accused the CPI(M) of pursuing the politics of violence against its adversaries in the State.

Mr. Rajasekharan said in a statement here on Tuesday that the murder of RSS activist Sujith in Kannur was proof that the CPI(M) has not relinquished violence.

Sujith and his family were targeted for working for the BJP in the local body elections in Mattannur.

Even after incurring public rage, the CPI(M) has not decided to eschew the path of violence.

The party should take steps to resume peace in Kannur, he said.
title: CPI(M) has not given up violence, says BJP
